page.title: 03Working in Newport.
page.content: When I got outside before 6 o'clock this June morning the purring sounds of milking machine at Berry Hill filtered through the river mist told me I was not first out.Two locals in muddy wellies wandered up from the Marsh-too much rain this summer to poach the salmon! Ieuan the Milk is the first vehicle at the Square.I saw different farm workers also rushing to get to their herds. Richards Bus Co.start up,a luxury coach towards the Continent,more of their 60 or so fleet gather locals for R.N.A.D.Trecwn whilst some drive their cars to R.A.E. Aberporth.Fishguard Harbour workers pass home.Council road workers in their van wave to our Mr. Owen with his dustcart.Dr.Bignall flies past.A tractor fires,-silage time.Shops,Banks,School doors open 8am
